The United States Holocaust Memorial Museum Archives received the collection from the Ż̇ydowski Instytut Historyczny via the United States Holocaust Museum International Archives Project in Sep. 2007

bioghist.p: Jewish Historical Institute-Historical Calendar: 1928 - Opening of the Institute of Jewish Studies (with no permanent seat).The Institute of Judaic Studies was to teach Judaic secondary school subjects to reformed rabbis and teachers. Presidents of the Institute were outstanding historians: Mojzesz Schorr, Majer Balaban, Menachem Stein, Abraham Weiss. The Institute found domicile in the building of the Main Library at the Big Synagogue at Tłomackie, assigned, prior to World War II, for use over a period of four years; 1936-Completion of construction of the building of the Main Jewish Library and Institute of Jewish Studies (present ZIH domicile); October 1939 - Closing of the Library, collections taken away by the Germans; 16 November 1940 - Final closing of the Warsaw ghetto where the Library building was located

scopecontent.p: Contains selected papers of Bernard Mark (1908–1966), a historian of Poland, publicist, communist activist, and director of the Jewish Historical Institute (JHI) from 1949 to 1966. Part I includes materials related to Marks’ career; the less organized Part II includes notes made during his archival activity, copies of documents, and some personal materials. There are also photographs and posthumous materials such as memoirs, obituaries, and condolences.
